Almost everything in theoretical science is a matter of educated guesses and estimations.
For example: Pi and Epsilon are not rational numbers, so when expressed as a decimal, they have infinite digits and are an estimate.  Pi is close to 3.14 and Epsilon is close to zero.  Nobody has actually seen an individual proton or observed life being created from inanimate material.
